question.title: QtActivity onNewIntent blocks Qt signal
question.body:
I have an Android-app written with Qt 5 where I can read NFC-chips. Additionaly I am using some native Java functionality for updating (installing .apk) my application via Javas native PackageInstaller. The problem is, that the QNearFieldManager::targetDetected signal is not emitted anymore when I am using the onNewIntent-function of my Java-class derieved from QtActivity.

public class MyActivity extends QtActivity {

    @Override
    protected void onNewIntent(Intent intent) {
        switch (intent.getAction()) {
            case PACKAGE_INSTALLED_ACTION:
            // do installation and other stuff
               break;
        }
    }
}

QNearFieldManager* nfcManager = new QNearFieldManager();
connect(nfcManager, &QNearFieldManager::targetDetected, this, [=](QNearFieldTarget* target)
{
   // not invoked with Androids onNewIntent
   if (target != Q_NULLPTR)
   {
      // do things with the target
      target->deleteLater();
   }
});

The lambda-signal handler is not invoked anymore and so I cannot process the NFC-targets. When removing the onNewIntent function in my MyActivity class it works again, so I assume it is blocking the signal. Is there anything I can do? I really dont want to implement the NFC-functionality in Java as Qt already offers everything I need.

question_comments.body: There aren't any errors. The signal is simply not invoked as it seems to get blocked by the onNewIntent method.
Can you provide full logs with exact error?
